surface_layer.definition: A type of optical dispersion that affects the shape and duration of ultrashort laser pulses.

deep_layer.mechanism: Third-order dispersion causes different frequencies within a pulse to travel at slightly different speeds, leading to pulse broadening or distortion.
deep_layer.origin: Optical physics and laser pulse shaping techniques.

examples: Using prism pairs or chirped mirrors to compensate for third-order dispersion.

epistemic_metadata.source: Spectral phase control for optimized ionization injection in laser ...
